channel.title: CVE Feed for PTC -- Vuforia Studio
channel.description: The latest CVEs for PTC -- Vuforia Studio

item.title: CVE-2023-31200|2024-08-02T14:45:26.042Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: PTC Vuforia Studio does not require a token; this could allow an attacker with local access to perform a cross-site request forgery attack or a replay attack.

item.title: CVE-2023-27881|2024-08-02T12:23:30.843Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: A user could use the “Upload Resource” functionality to upload files to any location on the disk.

item.title: CVE-2023-29152|2024-08-02T14:00:15.879Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: By changing the filename parameter in the request, an attacker could delete any file with the permissions of the Vuforia server account.

item.title: CVE-2023-29502|2024-08-02T14:07:46.433Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: Before importing a project into Vuforia, a user could modify the “resourceDirectory” attribute in the appConfig.json file to be a different path.

item.title: CVE-2023-29168|2024-08-02T14:00:15.871Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: The local Vuforia web application does not support HTTPS, and federated credentials are passed via basic authentication.

item.title: CVE-2023-24476|2024-08-02T10:56:04.159Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: An attacker with local access to the machine could record the traffic, which could allow them to resend requests without the server authenticating that the user or session are valid.
